main_idea.title: Out-of-time-ordered-correlator in quantum optical models
main_idea.description: This article discusses the evolution of out-of-time-ordered correlator for various quantum optical models and identifies the regime showing chaotic behavior.

sub_idea.title: OTOC in the generalized Dicke model
sub_idea.description: The behavior of OTOC for the generalized Dicke model is studied using hermitian operators and master equations.

sub_idea.title: Identification of quantum chaos
sub_idea.description: The study of quantum chaos seeks to find a relationship between the classical and quantum dynamics of chaotic systems using various strategies.

sub_idea.title: Random matrix theory ideas
sub_idea.description: Random matrix theory ideas formulated by Wigner and Dyson are used to understand the spectra of complex atomic nuclei and probe quantum systems with chaotic classical counterparts.

sub_idea.title: Study of various quantum optical models
sub_idea.description: The time-dependent interaction strength between the atom and cavity field for the Floquet Dicke model and the boundaries of phase transitions for various models are studied.

sub_idea.title: Phase transition between normal and superradiant phases
sub_idea.description: The phase transition between normal and superradiant phases is discussed for the generalized, N-qubit, Tavis-Cummings and Floquet Dicke models.

sub_idea.title: Connection between OTOCs
sub_idea.description: The various forms of OTOCs and their connection using Wigner-Yanase skew information are discussed, along with the relationship between out-of-time-ordered and time-ordered correlators.

sub_idea.title: Non-unitary evolution and adjoint form of the GKSL quantum master equation
sub_idea.description: A non-unitary evolution of operators and adjoint form of the GKSL quantum master equation are considered to calculate OTOC in a more realistic picture.
